author: jmcnally
msg: torque is requiring all db's to be named within the xml file (with "default" being
treated the same as any other name.  Therefore velocity code to select whether to
assign a dbName in the Peer will not work.  I moved the code to do so within a java
conditional, so that the db to be used can still be overridden.
Unfortunately none of the save methods in the OM's exercise this code, so I am
not able to test.  But this code should result in the same behavior exhibited

author: jmcnally
msg: made a protected attribute private as it was not in use by any subclasses.
Storing the result of a configuration property lookup locally to ensure that
the same object is used when comparing whether the default db is used.

author: jvanzyl
msg: - playing around with a new datamodel format. one that is easier to produce
after having BCEL walk over an object model, and one that is easier to
parse with the default mapping behaviour using the Digester with the new
